TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit ApplicationManifest extends Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.AssemblyManifest

Docs.summary: Describes a ClickOnce or native Win32 application manifest.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string targetFrameworkVersion) cil managed

Docs.param: A token that represents a version of the .NET Framework.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
Gets or sets the application configuration file.
Docs.value: A string that represents the name of the application configuration file.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For a native Win32 manifest, this input is ignored.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets an assembly reference that represents the entry point of the application.
Docs.value: An object that represents the entry point of the application.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the URL of the error report.
Docs.value: A string that contains the URL of the error report.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the file associations that are defined in the manifest.
Docs.value: A string that contains the file associations.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the application is hosted in a browser (as WPF Web Browser Applications are).
Docs.value: A Boolean value that indicates whether the application being deployed will be hosted in a browser (), or not (). applies only to WPF Web Browser Applications.

remarks.format:
## Remarks For project types other than WPF Web Browser Applications, you should set HostInBrowser to `False` (the default value).
When you deploy a WPF Web Browser Application, you must set the HostInBrowser property to `True`. This causes the `<hostInBrowser>` tag to be added to the generated application manifest. This tag enables ClickOnce to deploy projects for browser-hosted applications, which contain .xbap files.
You will also have to make the application available only online by setting <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.DeployManifest.Install%2A> to `False`. If you do not do this, you will receive [MSBuild Error MSB3116](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the program icon file.
Docs.value: A string that represents the name of the icon file.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The program icon is expressed in the generated application manifest and is used for the **Start** menu and **Add or Remove Programs**. If this the icon file is not specified, a default icon is used. For a native Win32 manifest, this input is ignored.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the manifest is a ClickOnce application manifest or a native Win32 application manifest.
Docs.value: A Boolean value that indicates whether the manifest is a ClickOnce application manifest () or a native Win32 manifest ().

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the maximum allowed length of a file path in a ClickOnce application deployment. If this value is specified, the length of each file path in the application is checked against this limit. Any items that exceed the limit cause a warning message. If this input is not specified or is zero, no checking is performed. For a native Win32 manifest, this input is ignored.
Docs.value: An integer that indicates the maximum allowed length of a file path in a ClickOnce application deployment.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies a textual description for the operating system dependency.
Docs.value: A string that indicates the operating system dependency.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies a support URL for the operating system dependency.
Docs.value: A string indicating the support URL for the operating system dependency.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the minimum required operating system version required by the application.
Docs.value: A string that indicates the minimum required operating system version required by the application.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Specifies the minimum operating system version required by the application. An example value is "5.1.2600.0" for Windows XP. If this input is not specified, a default value is used. The default value is the minimum supported operating system of the .NET Framework, which is "4.10.0.0" for Windows 98SE. However, if the application contains any native or Reg-Free COM references, the default is Windows XP. For a native Win32 manifest, this input is ignored.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the property in the project file.
Docs.value: A string value that corresponds to the property in the project file.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property corresponds to the `ProductName` property in the project file. The default is null. If `ProductName` is null and <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.ApplicationManifest.UseApplicationTrust%2A> is `True`, the RegisteredOrganization value in the registry is written to the application manifest. If RegisteredOrganization is also null, the assembly name is used.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the property in the project file.
Docs.value: A string value that corresponds to the property in the project file.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property corresponds to the `PublisherName` property in the project file. The default is null. If `PublisherName` is null and <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.ApplicationManifest.UseApplicationTrust%2A> is `True`, the assembly name is written to the application manifest.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the suite name that is defined in the manifest.
Docs.value: A string that contains the suite name.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the property in the project file.
Docs.value: A string value that corresponds to the property in the project file.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property corresponds to the `SupportUrl` property in the project file. The default is null. If `SupportUrl` is null and <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.ApplicationManifest.UseApplicationTrust%2A> is `True`, an empty string is written to the application manifest.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a token that represents a version of the .NET Framework.
Docs.value: A <xref:System.String> that represents a version of the .NET Framework.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies a trust object that defines the application security.
Docs.value: A object that defines the application security.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.ApplicationManifest.Product%2A>, <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.ApplicationManifest.Publisher%2A>, and <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.ApplicationManifest.SupportUrl%2A> properties are written to the application manifest.
Docs.value: A Boolean value that indicates whether the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.ApplicationManifest.Publisher%2A>, <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.ApplicationManifest.Product%2A>, and <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.ApplicationManifest.SupportUrl%2A> properties are written to the application manifest. If the value is , they are written to the application manifest. If the value is , these properties are ignored.

remarks.format:
## Remarks By default, the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.ApplicationManifest.Product%2A>, <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.ApplicationManifest.Publisher%2A>, and <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.ApplicationManifest.SupportUrl%2A> properties are set to null. They are used only if UseApplicationTrust is `True`. If this property is `True`, the values of these properties are written to the corresponding tags in the application manifest.
If UseApplicationTrust is `False` (the default value), these properties are ignored.
This property corresponds to the `UseApplicationTrust` property in the project file.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void Validate() cil managed

Docs.summary: Performs various checks to verify the validity of the manifest. Any resulting errors or warnings are reported in the object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Before calling this method, you must set the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.ApplicationManifest.TargetFrameworkVersion%2A> property so that the validation can verify application manifest against the correct version of the .NET Framework runtime.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a property that is used to serialize the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.ApplicationManifest.ConfigFile%2A> property to an XML file.
Docs.value: The value of the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.ApplicationManifest.ConfigFile%2A> property.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a property that is used to serialize the entry point identity to an XML file.
Docs.value: The entry point identity.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a property that is used to serialize the entry point parameters to an XML file.
Docs.value: The entry point parameters.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a property that specifies the entry point for executing the assembly and that is used to serialize the entry point to an XML file.
Docs.value: The entry point for executing the assembly.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a property that is used to serialize the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.ApplicationManifest.ErrorReportUrl%2A> property to an XML file.
Docs.value: The value of the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.ApplicationManifest.ErrorReportUrl%2A> property.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a property that is used to serialize the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.ApplicationManifest.FileAssociations%2A> property to an XML file.
Docs.value: The value of the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.ApplicationManifest.FileAssociations%2A> property.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a property that is used to serialize the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.ApplicationManifest.HostInBrowser%2A> property to an XML file.
Docs.value: or . The value of the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.ApplicationManifest.HostInBrowser%2A> property.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a property that is used to serialize the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.ApplicationManifest.IconFile%2A> property to an XML file.
Docs.value: The value of the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.ApplicationManifest.IconFile%2A> property.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a property that is used to serialize the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.ApplicationManifest.IsClickOnceManifest%2A> property to an XML file.
Docs.value: or . The value of the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.ApplicationManifest.IsClickOnceManifest%2A> property.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a property that is used to serialize the build version of the operating system to an XML file.
Docs.value: The build version of the operating system.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a property that is used to serialize the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.ApplicationManifest.OSDescription%2A> property to an XML file.
Docs.value: The value of the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.ApplicationManifest.OSDescription%2A> property.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a property that is used to serialize the major portion of the version number of the operating system to an XML file.
Docs.value: The major portion of the version number of the operating system.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a property that is used to serialize the minor portion of the version number of the operating system to an XML file.
Docs.value: The minor portion of the version number of the operating system.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a property that is used to serialize the revision portion of the version number of the operating system to an XML file.
Docs.value: The revision portion of the version number of the operating system.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a property that is used to serialize the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.ApplicationManifest.OSSupportUrl%2A> property to an XML file.
Docs.value: The value of the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.ApplicationManifest.OSSupportUrl%2A> property.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a property that is used to serialize the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.ApplicationManifest.Product%2A> property to an XML file.
Docs.value: The value of the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.ApplicationManifest.Product%2A> property.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a property that is used to serialize the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.ApplicationManifest.Publisher%2A> property to an XML file.
Docs.value: The value of the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.ApplicationManifest.Publisher%2A> property.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a property that is used to serialize the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.ApplicationManifest.SuiteName%2A> property to an XML file.
Docs.value: The value of the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.ApplicationManifest.SuiteName%2A> property.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a property that is used to serialize the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.ApplicationManifest.SupportUrl%2A> property to an XML file.
Docs.value: The value of the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.ApplicationManifest.SupportUrl%2A> property.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a property that is used to serialize the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.ApplicationManifest.UseApplicationTrust%2A> property to an XML file.
Docs.value: The value of the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.ApplicationManifest.UseApplicationTrust%2A> property.
